intro: Arrojadocharis praxeloides, commonly known as the Brazilian nightshade, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant is characterized by its dark purple to black berries, which are typically harvested when fully ripe. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its toxic properties, it is important to handle the plant with care.
